required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ext. Long-term Safety Study in CF Patients: Single Arm TIP
clinical_study.official_title: A 48 Week Extension to CTBM100C2401, a Single Arm, Open-label, Multicenter, Phase IV Extension Trial to Assess Long Term Safety of Tobramycin Inhalation Powder (TIP) in Patients With Cystic Fibrosis Who Completed Participation in CTBM100C2401.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this extension study is to collect additional 48 weeks of safety data from patients taking TIP who have completed the core study CTBM100C2401. The purpose of collecting second year safety data through this study is to obtain long-term (2 years) safety data of TIP.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 12 Treatment Cycles
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study) to Day 673 (end of the extension study)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Based on the severity, AEs were categorised into 3 types as mild, moderate and severe. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study), Day 29, Day 85, Day 141, Day 197, Day 253, Day 309, Day 337, Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant's age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted - baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Sputum Density Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study), Day 29, Day 85, Day 141, Day 197, Day 253, Day 309, Day 337, Day
secondary_outcome.description: Microbiological data was collected to understand the direct impact of the drug on the pathogens. Sputum samples were cultured for the presence of three Pseudomonas aeruginosa (P. aeruginosa) biotypes measured were mucoid, dry and small colony variant. Absolute change was determined using the formula = (Post-baseline value- baseline value). If no P. aeruginosa was isolated for a visit, log10 colony forming units (CFU) was imputed with log10 (19) for all biotypes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tobramycin Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) 50 and MIC 90 Values for Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study), Day 29, Day 85, Day 141, Day 197, Day 253, Day 309, Day 337, Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: MIC was defined as the lowest concentration of an antimicrobial agent required to inhibit the visible growth of a microorganism after overnight incubation. Tobramycin MIC 50 and MIC 90 values were defined as the lowest concentration of tobramycin required to inhibit 50% and 90%, respectively, of the P. aeruginosa strains tested (mucoid,dry and small colony variant biotypes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Used New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of anti-pseudomonal antibiotics use were determined from the collection of concomitant medication during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Days of New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics Use Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of days with usage of new anti-pseudomonal antibiotic were determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Use of New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first usage of anti-pseudomonal antibiotic was determined using Kaplan Meier estimate. Participants without an event were censored at the date of the last available post-baseline measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of the Participants Hospitalized Due to Serious Respiratory-related AEs Were Determined During the Study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the participants hospitalized due to serious respiratory-related AEs were determined during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalization Days Due to Respiratory Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of hospitalization days due to serious respiratory-related adverse events was analyzed using Kaplan-Meier estimate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Hospitalization Due to Respiratory Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of core study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The day of first hospitalization due to serious respiratory-related adverse events was analysed using Kaplan Meier estimate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute Relative Change From Pre-dose to 30-minute Post-dose in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 12 Treatment Cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study), Day 29, Day 85, Day 141, Day 197, Day 253, Day 309, Day 337, Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted was calculated by using the formula = 100 *(30-min post-dose value - pre-dose value) / pre-dose value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study), Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant's age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted - baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Density Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study), Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: Microbiological data was collected to understand the direct impact of the drug on the pathogens. Sputum samples were cultured for the presence of three Pseudomonas aeruginosa (P. aeruginosa) biotypes measured were mucoid, dry and small colony variant. If no P. aeruginosa was isolated for a visit, log10 colony forming units (CFU) was imputed with log10 (19) for all biotypes. Absolute change was calculated by using the formula = (Value at actual time point - start of extension value).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Used New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of anti-pseudomonal antibiotics use were determined from the collection of concomitant medication during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Days of New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics Use in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of days with usage of new anti-pseudomonal antibiotic were determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Use of New Anti-pseudomonal Antibiotics in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first usage of anti-pseudomonal antibiotic was determined using Kaplan Meier estimate. Participants without an event were censored at the date of the last available post-baseline measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Hospitalized Due to Respiratory Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the participants hospitalized due to serious respiratory-related AEs were determined during the extension study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalization Days Due to Respiratory Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of hospitalisation days due to serious respiratory-related adverse events was analysed using Kaplan-Meier estimate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Hospitalization Due to Respiratory Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline of extension study, Day 673 (end of extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: The day of first hospitalization due to serious respiratory related adverse events was analysed using Kaplan Meier estimate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study) to Day 673 (end of the extension study)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalisation, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completion of the core study CTBM100C2401 and able to comply with all protocol requirements of the extension study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serum creatinine 2mg/dl, BUN 40mg/dl or proteinuria 2+ or more at the time of entry into the extension
- Use of loop diuretics within 7 days prior to entry into the extension study
- Pregnant or nursing women
- Women of child bearing potential unless using highly effective method of contraception as indicated in the protoco

clinical_study.keyword: CF, Open-label, TIP, phase IV, extension study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 22 centers in 9 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 96 participants who completed the core study (CTBM100C2401), NCT01519661; 45 participants were enrolled in the extension study.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) twice daily (bid) via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 12 Treatment Cycles
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Based on the severity, AEs were categorised into 3 types as mild, moderate and severe. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study) to Day 673 (end of the extension study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 12 Treatment Cycles
measure.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Based on the severity, AEs were categorised into 3 types as mild, moderate and severe. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.

class.title: Discontinued study drug due to AEs
Discontinued study drug due to SAEs

outcome.title: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 12 Treatment Cycles
outcome.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant’s age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted – baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in core study), Day 29, Day 85, Day 141, Day 197, Day 253, Day 309, Day 337, Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
outcome.population: Extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension and had FEV1% values at both baseline and the post baseline time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

measure.title: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 12 Treatment Cycles
measure.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant’s age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted – baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.
measure.population: Extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension and had FEV1% values at both baseline and the post baseline time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Sputum Density Over 12 Treatment Cycles
outcome.description: Microbiological data was collected to understand the direct impact of the drug on the pathogens. Sputum samples were cultured for the presence of three Pseudomonas aeruginosa (P. aeruginosa) biotypes measured were mucoid, dry and small colony variant. Absolute change was determined using the formula = (Post-baseline value- baseline value). If no P. aeruginosa was isolated for a visit, log10 colony forming units (CFU) was imputed with log10 (19) for all biotypes.

outcome.title: Tobramycin Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) 50 and MIC 90 Values for Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Over 12 Treatment Cycles
outcome.description: MIC was defined as the lowest concentration of an antimicrobial agent required to inhibit the visible growth of a microorganism after overnight incubation. Tobramycin MIC 50 and MIC 90 values were defined as the lowest concentration of tobramycin required to inhibit 50% and 90%, respectively, of the P. aeruginosa strains tested (mucoid,dry and small colony variant biotypes).

measure.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

outcome.title: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
outcome.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant’s age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted – baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study), Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
outcome.population: Extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension and had FEV1% values at both baseline and the post baseline time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

measure.title: Relative Change From Baseline in Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) Percent Predicted Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
measure.description: FEV1 was defined as the volume of air expired in 1 second. FEV1 was assessed as a pulmonary function by using spirometry tests in accordance with American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) criteria. FEV1% predicted is a normalized value of FEV1 calculated using the Knudsen equation, based upon participant’s age, gender and height. Relative change in FEV1 % predicted from baseline to pre-dose day X = ((pre-dose day*FEV1% predicted – baseline FEV1% predicted) / baseline FEV1 % predicted) x 100.
measure.population: Extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension and had FEV1% values at both baseline and the post baseline time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

outcome.title: Absolute Change From Baseline in Pseudomonas Aeruginosa Density Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
outcome.description: Microbiological data was collected to understand the direct impact of the drug on the pathogens. Sputum samples were cultured for the presence of three Pseudomonas aeruginosa (P. aeruginosa) biotypes measured were mucoid, dry and small colony variant. If no P. aeruginosa was isolated for a visit, log10 colony forming units (CFU) was imputed with log10 (19) for all biotypes. Absolute change was calculated by using the formula = (Value at actual time point - start of extension value).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study), Day 365, Day 421, Day 477, Day 533, Day 589, Day 645, 673 (end of the extension study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population, who had microbiological data at specified time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

measure.description: Microbiological data was collected to understand the direct impact of the drug on the pathogens. Sputum samples were cultured for the presence of three Pseudomonas aeruginosa (P. aeruginosa) biotypes measured were mucoid, dry and small colony variant. If no P. aeruginosa was isolated for a visit, log10 colony forming units (CFU) was imputed with log10 (19) for all biotypes. Absolute change was calculated by using the formula = (Value at actual time point - start of extension value).
measure.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population, who had microbiological data at specified time points. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

measurement_list.measurement: Here, value is not applicable due to insufficient number of events.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalisation, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study) to Day 673 (end of the extension study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension.

group.title: Tobramycin Inhalation Powder
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid).The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), AEs/SAEs Leading to Discontinuation of Study Drug and Deaths Over 6 Treatment Cycles in Extension Study
measure.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to study drug. A SAE was defined as an event which was fatal or life threatening, required or prolonged hospitalisation, was significantly or permanently disabling or incapacitating, constituted a congenital anomaly or a birth defect, or encompassed any other clinically significant event that could jeopardize the participant or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the aforementioned outcomes. Death was a fatal event leading to permanent cessations of all vital functions of the body.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in extension safety population, defined as all the participants who entered the extension study and received at least one dose of study drug within the extension.

class.title: Discontinued study drug due to AEs
Discontinued study drug due to SAEs

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline (start of study treatment in extension study) to Day 673 (end of the extension study)

group.title: Core
group.description: Eligible participants were assigned to four capsules of TIP at 28 mg dosage strength, inhaled b.i.d. in the morning and in the evening via the T-326 inhaler, for 28 days (on treatment), followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment). Each treatment therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose = 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg b.i.d.). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy during core study.

group.title: Extension
group.description: Participants inhaled four capsules of tobramycin inhalation powder (28 mg) bid via the T-326 inhaler device, for 28 days (treatment phase in each cycle). Each treatment phase therefore consisted of 112 mg tobramycin (4 capsules of 28 mg each) with the total daily dose of 224 mg tobramycin (112 mg bid). The treatment phase was followed by 28 days of no study treatment (off treatment in each cycle). These 56 days represented 1 cycle of therapy.

group.title: Overall
group.description: All participants who inhaled tobramycin inhalation powder during both core and extension study.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis
Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
